info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 26 at 2:02PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Moderate to heavy snow showers will impact portions of Lewis and Clark, central Pondera, eastern Glacier, Teton and western Cascade Counties through 245 PM MST... At 158 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking snow showers along a line extending from 15 miles northeast of North Browning to 12 miles to miles northwest of Basin. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Visibility one-half mile or less due to falling snow. Expect rapidly changing road conditions. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Locations impacted include... Cut Bank, Conrad, Choteau, Cascade, Lincoln, Fairfield, Valier, Dutton, Fort Shaw, Brady, Augusta, Wolf Creek, Fort Shaw, Power, Dupuyer, Pishkun Reservoir, Santa Rita, Simms, Nilan Reservoir and Bean Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 206 and 263, and between mile markers 321 and 355. Highway 200 between mile markers 65 and 139. Highway 2 between mile markers 231 and 262. Highway 89 between mile markers 9 and 100. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
